Food was great...  One plate is enough for two to eat and the pho rare steak soup very good.. Area clean .....

I'm from phila and I'm use to good food so when I find a place that blows me away I couldn't resist doing this. I lived in vegas for 20 years but most of my life was in phila. I tried Jasmine Express for the first time the other day and it was great. I ordered the orange chicken which had so much chicken inside and the flavor was Great. I tried a new dish to me called Hor Fun which is a noodle dish and this also was fantastic. The Fried rice is up there with the best Fried Rice I ever had in phila and for sure the best one in Las Vegas.. I'm not sure about you, but It's not easy if your use to great food as I was living in philadelphia most of my life to find a place here in Las Vegas that really gets your attention but this place did and even though I don't write reviews I had to give this place its due. It made a steady customer out of me..Name is Neil and thanks Jasmine Express for being there.
I ABSOLUTELY LOVE JASMINE EXPRESS they have the best drink menu and they have really good ice cream sandwich macaroon hybrids. So good love this place

Very misleading and disappointing! My family and I have been coming to this place for years! It seems tho that the restaurant has either changed owners or cook. Today's visit was due to a certificate of $10 I got from restaurants. com. Food was bad last time I came (about a month ago) but I decided to give it another chance. Unfortunately it was worse this time. I Un-wrapped the utensils from the enclosed napkin and got a dirty used fork! My parents orded the Kao pao chicken and i ordered the chicken chow main.  When the food came, the rice was hard like it wasn't even cooked. When I asked for the bill and showed my  restaurants.com certificate for $10, they only creditedy bill for $9.19. When I questioned the amount the server said "Yea, everyone knows that." Well NO. When you buy a certificate for a certain amount, you expect the business to credit the full advertised amount. Just a bad experience over all. I have I e more $10 certificate left and to be honest, I feel like throwing it away. No sense to going back for bad food And false advertising.

I wouldn't recommend eating here now.   Went to the restaurant after work to order dinner.  After paying I sat and waited, only to find 2 dead German cockaroaches dead in the lobby area of restaurant. Got my money back!

I wanted crab fried rice but they use the face stuff so I pass on it. I'm not sure who the guy was working behind the counter but he suggested  I try their dinner special rock crab with salt and pepper for $14.00This had to be on of the best dishes I ever eaten! The portions was huge,If I was back in jersey and or something like this it would have cost more line $25. This was the best $14 I ever spent!!

Tried this place for the first time last week and we were VERY happy with everything we tried.  We ordered egg fried rice, veggie egg foo young, shiu mai, chicken noodle soup, won ton soup and pepper steak.  Seriously, everything was really very good!  The soups especially were a great surprise....all the noodles were the homemade long egg noodles.  Yummo!    As the previous reviewer stated, the service does take a little longer than your normal take out place, but it's well worth the wait.    The service is outstanding and everyone was very friendly.    I highly recommend Jasmine Express!!!
There are a lot of Chinese restaurants around here.  Unfortunately they all kind of taste the same.  The food here was good, but nothing stood out as extraordinary.

We come a lot here but they had changed their hours from 11am to 12pm for opening. It's 1225pm and no one has showed up..not only did they lose customers but they show no consideration for their customers to at least put a sign up if they are not opening! Finding another pho place that will appreciate us.

I ordered the strawberry smoothie with boba and it was delicious! I have had smoothies other places and it is high on my list. The smoothie was blended well; I did not have any big chunks of ice like you find at some places and the flavor was consistent throughout.   I also ordered the veggie egg rolls to go along with the smoothie for a quick lunch. The egg rolls were crispy and I like the sauce, but they are pretty much the *industry standard* egg rolls. The price was fair and a nice cold treat on a hot day. I did not call ahead and everything was ready in about 5 minutes.

It's hard to find good Chinese food anymore, especially with delivery. This place got the job done. Did it blow my mind? Eh, not really, but it had some high points.  I found the chicken fried rice totally awesome. Just salty enough, great flavor, really good.  The sweet n' sour chicken was good, but they should consider putting the sauce on the side when doing delivery. It was very soggy, so I ended up pulling off the outsides and just eating the middle.  The lo mein would've been good -- the chicken in it was white meat and cooked well - but the noodles were way overcooked (again, likely due to the delivery time), so they were mush. And I though it was a little bland.  The pork wontons I really liked. My boyfriend didn't like them as much because he really likes those kinds that are just a big fried noodle with a tiny dot of meat in the middle. These have more meat, but are still quite good, in my opinion.  The crab rangoon was... average. Cooked well, tasted fine. I'd order those again, but they weren't a stand-out, really.  The steamed rice was cooked well and not mushy or underdone.  The whole thing, including delivery tip was $40 or so, not too bad and they were right on time -- 30 minutes.  I'd order from here again, though I might try some other items that won't sog-out, preferably something with vegetables!
Had the pho today to go and it was delicious.  Everything was packed nicely and was still warm when I got home.

First off I'm not the type of person who wants to give restaurants a bad review, I like to leave my remarks.   First time trying Jasmin Express Cuisine, and I'm very sorry to say I AM DISAPPOINTED.  Went there ordered my food, the guy named Chris said it would be ready in 15 minutes but I was there for 45.  I ordered Veggies Fried Rice, Fried Tofu, and Tom Ka Chicken...  My Wife is a Vegetarian so she eats tofu to substitute meat, out off all the restaurants we have ordered tofu from...this order was just nasty. Very very, and I mean VERY soggy. The Veggie Fried Rice tasted like shit, and on top of that they failed to mention that the Tom Ka Chicken was a soup..it was separated to the "soup" section.  And one more thing, the guy Chris not to give an insult but loosen up kid... your too nervous. Instead of saying "hey, hey you" ask people for their names for they're order I promise it'll be easier on you.  Never eating here again, Golden Phoenix is waaaay better and quality.
Great fried rice and the pad thai is even better!!! My munchies stop!!!! Omg and the boba selection!!!!

This is my favorite place to get pho however recently when I've been getting it delivered something is always off. One time the limes were old and the broth wasn't up to par. Obviously was a bad batch but this time was the last straw! They put pho in a big styrofoam soda cup which is totally fine, perfect serving, but the top was a soda cup top with the hole in it so naturally when it's being delivered it has the possibility of getting knocked over and spill a little bit but half of my pho was spilled in the bag with the spicy sauce melted in the plastic container with the broth.This would not have happened if they put it in their usual container. I'm very unhappy with this service today!
They have boba milk teas here in North Las vegas.   Eddie was excellent cashier. Bogo on milk teas and smoothies (:
Wow..I got my Pho to go. Rare beef,  with all the trimmings. The broth was hot and amazing even when I got home. The veggies were very fresh and everything was very good.
Bad food, bad service & long wait times. Avoid if possible, if not I Hope you have better luck than I did.

We went based on the reviews and we were pleasantly surprised. We only tried the combo pho and the combo vermicelli, but they were both good. My husband liked the ice coffee too. The service and variety were fine. The food is better near Chinatown, but that doesn't mean this place wasn't good for what we had. I do think the AC needs to be turned up. Good Vietnamese food near Aliante.

This place had high stars on Postmates and I needed Thai food... extremely disappointed.  6 dollars for the worst, cheapest spring rolls I have ever eaten... literally. Check out the photo of them.   I also got my favorite Tom Ka soup.. definitely the most lacking Tom kha I've ever had.   I wish i had more to say, this is probably the most vague review I've ever posted, but I'm currently just meh.. I'd rather drive 15 minutes and get Thai to go rather than order from here again.

this place is a joke... I came in and ordered 2 smoothies and they made me wait 25 minutes for 2 drinks... they gave us a straw that had sticky substance on it... WTF. it was expensive for no reason and the smoothies weren't even tasty. NEVER COMING BACK.

I was excited about this restaurant because I could get a bowl of pho without having to drive across town. The pho is good but the service is terrible. Delivery time is over an hour so I decided to pick up the next time. I ordered two pho and 1 order of egg rolls. I left my house 10 minutes after I ordered thinking it would be ready by the time I drove up there. But I was wrong. When I got there not only was my order not ready. I don't even think she put it in. Also she told me that there was only enough pho for one order something she could have told me over the phone before I drove up there. So I waited in there hot restaurant for another twenty minute just to receive half my order. I was not offered anything for free to make up for their mistake.

The service is good. My friends and I come here often because we live around the area. I regularly order the Mongolian Beef, Combination Pho and Szechuan Beef; all good tasting. I like that they give 2 free vegetable rolls. Sad that they discontinued the Rambutan flavored drinks.
This place has great food! Szchuan chicken and eggplant are my favorites. It's always fresh and tasty.

We got takeout from Jasmine Express about a week ago. It was decent, but not incredible. The Mongolian Beef was very good, the dumplings and fried rice were okay, and the Orange Chicken was just meh (didn't even taste "orangey" at all). I would recommend JE, however, my wife and I actually prefer New China Cuisine which is right across the street. Overall their food is better and they do combo family meals which helps keep the price down a bit compared to JE.

I wanted to love Jasmine Express because I'm a huge boba fan. Unfortunately this place seems to be a bit sub-par.   The first time that me and my fiancee went here, we got two of the specialty boba drinks, both off of their "favorites" listed on the wall.   Anyone familiar with boba knows the difference between normal, fresh boba & boba that's started to break down because it's been sitting too long. Our boba balls seemed to be the latter.   My fiance's milk tea had a somewhat soapy flavor, and he didn't even finish it.  We chalked it up to a bad day at the restaurant. We gave the place another shot a few weeks later.  We tried to play it safe this time by just getting Thai tea with boba, and while it was okay, it was definitely some sort of pre-mix. There was no color differentiation from liquid creamer, so I suspect it was powdered creamer. You could taste something was off.   While we were sitting waiting for our tea, we saw a sign that said free Thai tea with order of crab ragoons (or something small like that, I don't remember specifically). It would have been much cheaper for us to order that way, as the food item was a few dollars less than a Thai tea by itself was, but our cashier said nothing about this deal when we were ordering.   Overall I'm pretty disappointed in Jasmine Express. Hope I can find a good boba place soon here!
Hot and sour soup is very bitter. It is almost like it is made of pure sour. Food is decent. My husband enjoyed the rice. It was mediocre Chinese food.

Good food lots of choices for boba tea. The service was very good the only thing I was not sure about was I ordered chicken pho and my wife ordered rare steak but the broth was the same and I am not use to that. Thou it was good pho. We will definitely be back soon. The stamp discount is great as well.
Two stars bcs the place and Food was decent. But I found two strand of hair in my spring rolls :( come on guys
Come here frequently oxtail soup is amazing great teas as well, a definite must is the fried rice one of my favorite places to get it from! And all the staff is very friendly and helpful as well!

We have ordered here about four times, and enjoyed the large quantities of food and the delivery option. They also deliver boba which is a plus. The price can be a bit high however for what you are getting.   We had pretty good results the first three times we went, I would have given it 4 stars on a normal day.   This is however the last time that we will be ordering from them. Though the food may normally be ok, the bad service we revived today has put a stop to it.   Today we were having a date night and relaxing at home after a hectic week. We ordered our food, and it arrived an hour later like normal. We were eager to get to our food. The wife ordered a curry and I ordered the beef and peppers. I asked for extra spicy, it wasn't spicy, but worse things happen, I guess I'm used to this by now. The biggest problem is that the meat in my wife's curry was white and cut thin. Almost light tan. Much different from the brown and hearty beef in my meal, and even different from last 2 weeks when she ordered it. We don't normally call an establishment, but this time we tried. My wife doesn't like pork so her meal was pretty much inedible to her. The man who answered the phone said, "don't worry, that's beef. Your wife is just confused. Eat it, you will see it is just beef and it will be tasty. " After we told him it wasn't tasty and we weren't happy with it, there was no attempt whatsoever to try to fix it. He sat there awkwardly on the phone waiting for me to change my mind and accept that the pork was beef. I told him that if there was nothing they could do, that we would not order from here again.   Either they messed up and didn't want to own up to it, or they changed their recipe in the last week, and it's no longer tasty. Either way we are done with this place. We will stick to Thai Basil down the street.

After wanting to get some good quality viet food but being to lazy to drive to China town, my wife and I decided to check this place out. First impression was ugly decor, poor ventilation, and the fruits in the storage looked like they were rotting. But that has never stopped me from eating good quality food, so we went ahead and sat down. My wife was happy when she they had a young coconut drink. Saw the dude pull it out of the rotting fruit section. I tried it and felt it was disgusting, my wife said it was good. Egg rolls were terrible, and I ordered the special combination vermicelli and my wife ordered the egg roll vermicelli. Long story short food was bland and not worth the price. I highly doubt we will ever visit this establishment again.
Me and my girlfriend come all the time, since we moved. It's really close to our house and it has awesome boba and food! it also has a lot of choice and options :) yum

My family and I have been coming here for several years now and we just love this place. Their food is good and tasty and very affordable. I'm so glad that they started doing bobas now coz back then they didn't have it. Now they have tons of flavors to choose from. But my favorite here is the tofu salt & pepper, beef & broccoli, orange chicken, pho and so on. Everything is a must try except for pork coz we don't eat them. But come check it out. Big shout out to Chris for working so hard
The drinks aren't that bad, but the wait time is ridiculous? 30 minutes for a boba drink. Come on!! They don't apologize or anything.

The food and service was not up to par last time we ate there it was great this time it was bad. We waited more than 20 minutes for someone to come and give us menus and take our order it took a long time to get drinks, hey gentleman walked in went to the counter waved sat down and was served his food before we even got our food and we have been there 20 minutes prior to him walking in. Do not eat the chili sauce we lifted the lid there was black mold we informed the waiter of the mold and he just took the container and moved to another table and nor did he ask us if we would like to have a fresh batch of chili sauce as for the food it was not up to par, not fresh and like I said the service suck. We know if we're going to ever go back again.

I have been coming here for a few months now and Jasmine Express is still the best in Las Vegas compared to what China Town has to offer. The service is excellent. Chris and everyone who works here are really nice and treats the customers courteously.

By far the wost 40$ I've spent at an Asian restaurant. Came in ordered and everything was ready in ten minutes. The food tasted recooked, old,  mircowaved. Not worth what I paid. Will never come here again!! Totally gross. Panda Express is better and that's saying something because they have crappy food too.

The chicken tasted like rubber. We fought flies the whole time we ate! The worst! There wasn't anyone else there and yet it took 45 minutes to get our food. One person out of six in our party did like her food. She got  the beef.

We love this place ! I have never had a bad meal here . It's hands down the best pho in the area . The restaurant is always clean and staff is friendly . We got a delivery about a week ago and there were a few issues with it . I sent a message to the restaurant and immediately received a response . The owner was amazing . He not only refunded our order but when we went in there today he paid for our entire meal . Customer service like this is what restaurants  should strive for ! Thank you and we will be back !

Their Vietnamese dishes are on point; vermicelli, pho, and rice plates. The smoothies are also on point. Everything else, from what I've tried; Chinese dishes (orange chicken, lemon chicken, shumai), Thai dishes (curry, pad thai), aren't all that great. The spring rolls, egg rolls, pork buns and sesame balls are pretty awesome too.

***I wish I could rate negative stars!***   Make sure to order ahead of time before coming to dine in or else you'll be waiting for one hour and a half! I was told it was normal to wait long during a "rush!" When we finally received our food, my chicken was cold!! The manager told me that he will replace my COLD food bc he is nice! The "manager" will also call you a liar! You won't have anything to drink for your entire meal! And to top things off he stood in my face and lied at the fact that people ordered ahead and that is why they served them first! Even though I proved him wrong by asking another customer in the place if they ordered ahead and was told no!! And he had nothing to say to that!    ****DO NOT EAT HERE!!****    Make the trip down to china town- it will be worth it!

I love this place. I went back 3 days in a row trying different items. And the staff was awesome too.... funny guys :)  the boba green tea with kiwi is what has me. its awesome... thanks guys for the great food and service. See you again... :)
My local Chinese spot never disappoints me... Good service (for a Chinese restaurant at least) fresh and fast I go at least 4x a month!

I'm kind of confused by Jasmine Express. They're a Vietnamese, Chinese, Thai fusion type of place which makes ordering off the menu for delivery a little trying at best. I ordered steamed pork buns and I had envisioned the flaky bbq pork buns I've had at dim sum. These are not those buns. They're a bit more pasty and chewy in texture. I was a bit disappointed in that.  Their shrimp spring rolls are quite fresh and vibrant served with a side of peanut sauce. I find it a refreshingly light fair for the hot Vegas summers. Their fried rice could use some more flavor although it is already dark brown from the soy sauce but needing a kick of some sort. My order of General's chicken was extremely mild but on the upside it was overly breaded. It was nice big bites of chicken with very little breading. I'll just have to ask for it a bit spicier than I had ordered.  JE's vegetable egg rolls were nice and crispy. Mongolian beef was a good portion and tender. Next time I'll try a few different items as it seems their Chinese side of the menu is a bit week but their Vietnamese side is strong.

I like this place. There aren't a lot of good Chinese/Vietnamese restaurant choices up north- unless you're into the usual china-a-go-go type places. People are friendly and courteous and are more than happy to make any order cooked just the way you like it. The food is good too.
food is very good.  we dont have to run to china town anymore.  we were quite surprise.  I had pho and my wife had broccoli  beef.  wow it was so tasty and good.

I had a great experience with takeout here.  Mostly it was because the food was inexpensive and delicious...what's more to say!  Do yourself a favor and enjoy the Vietnamese spring rolls.  They are $4.95 for two huge rolls packed with cilantro, lettuce, and shrimp, served with yummy peanut sauce.  I have not yet found a place in Vegas that does a better job with true spring rolls--not the fried junk I see on bar menus.

The food is all good. Eveything Ive ordered is outrageous!  My fav is their Black Bean sauce. Anything with that sauce is the bomb!  Their Curry Shrimp fried rice is aweome too!  And another fav is their Honey Dew Kiwi Smoothie to die for..I keep coming here for their rice really..not many Chinese restaurants here make really good rice. For.me that is the key to good Chinese Cuisine!

Came here today for some boba tea unfortunately they didn't have any made so I tried the kiwi pearls in my mango and strawberry smoothie...it was *bomb* I loved it. I still like boba but the pearls are yummy to. I give this place a 5 star and recommend you guys to try the smoothies with pearls. :)

I came here with my boyfriend for Valentines day and they were packed and only one server working around the restaurant. We were seated promptly and it took awhile for the server to take our orders. The food came out late than expected. The food was delish and fresh so worth the wait. if you can't wait, panda express is right close by. the service was slower tonight but we were happy with the food.

Definitely a thumbs down. Seriously I'm not a picky eater at all. I'm usually the one that thinks everyone is crazy cause I think the food is good and everyone thinks it sucks. Not in this case!  First of all, their sign says hey open at 11am. I got there at 11:30 and their doors were locked but all signs said open. I thought I was retarded for a minute so I called and they just forgot to open the doors. I was seated by 11:36 (you just choose wherever) and was ready to order 2min later. The guy took 15 minutes to come & take my order! Then let me tell you how long I waited to get my food........ At 12:34pm!!!!!! Literally waited 1 whole hour for my food! And I was their only customer!! I was already frustrated but was expecting at least good food. Not the case! It didn't even look good! Had 2 bites and I was done! Not even my 1yr old that eats EVERYTHING wanted some.   So disappointed. Never ever again will I return. The only good thing was their Thai Tea Boba (really good actually) I guess that's where they get their 1 star. Besides that, save the trip and go else where!

I showed up at 12:30 Tuesday September 8, the day after Labor Day, to a sign on the door saying they're closed for the holiday. It says they'll be open on Tuesday but they're not. Not a soul to be found; the door locked, the lights off...nothing. I totally understand being closed for the holiday. But if you put a sign up saying you'll be open Tuesday, be open or change the sign. I won't be returning to see how the food is.
Their beef and their shrimp are among the worst quality of food I've had yet to try.   Egg drop soup was also not good. The base of the soup is disgusting.   Golden milk tea boba was delicious.

What with the frequency I've been visiting Jasmine Express, I think it's time I updated my review from a 3 star rating to an improved 4 star rating. Jasmine Express is an Asian fusion restaurant located off Ann & Camino Al Norte in the large Smith's shopping center. So why the update? Jasmine's vegetarian pho ($7.65) nursed me back to health (I may be exaggerating) when I was sick with a persistent cold. When I find myself eating solo for dinner, I get huge portions of take-out food with a 5-7 minute wait time here. Plus, how awesome is that Yelp check-in offer for two free egg rolls with any purchase? I love those vegetable egg rolls!   Most importantly, ever since I've discovered Boba and Thai Tea, Jasmine Express has been instrumental in catering to my addictions. They're open until 10PM most days, which is the latest Boba shop you'll find open around these parts. They have a huge drink menu with tons of choices and varieties. My husband and I have tried the Thai Tea ($3.75), Taro Smoothie ($.4.25), and Mocha Tea Smoothie ($4.25). That mocha tea was unbelievably good! I've been feigning to try their mint chocolate smoothie next.    Heads up though - customer service needs some major improvements. Just know that before coming in. They're not very knowledgeable on menu items and don't speak much. I wouldn't recommend dining in because service is slow and it tends to be very warm inside. It's very take it or leave it. Regardless, I have to say I'm a fan of Jasmine Express!  UPDATE: Jasmine Express has a military discount! Yay!  YELP 100 CHALLENGE 2015: #180

WARNING: Stay away  from this place. we ate there a few times with no problems. this last time my wife found what turned out to be a piece of steel wool in her fried rice.!  took it back and showed it to the employee. he thought it was no big deal! he barely said sorry. needless to say i won't be going back!

Groupon brought me here! The menu is extensive and they serve a lil bit of Thai, Vietnamese, and Chinese entrees. I was craving Chinese this time and decided to give it a try; ordered pineapple fried rice (tasty, with 6-7 pcs of shrimp), sesame chicken (just ok), & combination vermicelli (good), all to go. We didn't have to wait too long (10 minutes).   The food is at least 3 stars (A-OK and I will come back). I'm already marking down what I'll try next. The staff were all friendly and helpful. They pointed out that they always have specials going on, whether it's $20 worth of food for $10 Groupon or 20-25% coupon on their website. Make sure you check in on your Yelp app so you get 2 free veggie egg rolls.

I went to this place today because I was craving shrimp fried rice. The decor was very nice there was a nice family there eating and the customer service was great ....however my rice was not what I really wanted the shrimp wasn't cooked along with the rice and it did not taste as good as I would have liked! So I pretty much left disappointed and I threw the 8 dollar rice in the trash ...but everything looked good! I'm always willing to give places a second chance! So I may be going back

My boyfriend first discovered this hole in the wall because it was right next to Smiths, however it's an awesome thing he did because I LOVE the food there. I'm not big fan of Chinese food but this place changed my perception for the better. The lunch special that they have is really cheaper and you get a lot of bang for your buck. Depending on what main entrée you get it can range from $6.00 per plate to about $12.00, the meal includes soup of the day, the entrée, egg roll, and a huge helping of their amazing fried rice and the best part it actually comes with either iced/hot green tea with free refills. I personally like the basil chicken, it was large pieces of chicken as well as fresh vegetables.   I've tired many pho places and Jasmine Express has a legit broth which as you probably know with pho is a key element in the pho. I found it to be flavorful and I enjoyed every bite.

This is really more of a 2 star rating...but given there are not too many options in North Las Vegas....relative to the area and the options available, it gets 3 stars.  It's pretty much a glorified panda express menu with some Thai/Vietnamese offerings.  We tried the Vietnamese food....the grilled pork&shrimp, egg rolls, rice option and the similar vermicelli bowl option. The meat was rather dry and slightly on the salty side.  The egg rolls were quite mediocre and flavorless inside.  The noodles were cooked well....We also tried the fried chicken wing appetizer...and they were tasty but perhaps that was due to the excessive use of MSG as seasoning...none the less it was crispy goodness but I probably drank 3 glasses of water after the appetizer.  Will I come back?  Perhaps....there are just those days when I'm too lazy to drive....

Wanted to eat pho but didn't want to travel, this place popped up as closest to us. The Service was ok. Food not great. I ordered pho beef meatball and the noodles were overcooked and mushy. We probably won't be coming back here again. Taking the longer drive is worth it for better quality food.

This place has improved quite a bit since the last time I visited. I must say that their phô is just as good as the ones in china town. The portion size is good and the price is average. Definitely will be a place I will continue to go to for my phô cravings and Thai tea bobas!  Even bigger plus is that it's right in the north Las Vegas neighborhood.
I've been here a few times and I always leave very disappointed.  I'm officially done with these people. Horrible service and mediocre food.

VERY DIRTY establishment. Potstickers were incredibly bland. Took one bite, complained to the MANAGER and was told I ordered it so I had to pay. I wasn't complaining to not pay. .ughh REALLY BAD EXPERIENCE. My husband and daughters food were mediocre at best. Never again.
The place I come to in North Las Vegas for the best Asian takeout.  The Vietnamese rolls and milk teas are the best.

Quick and easy meal. Rare beef pho had a ton of meat in it. Super flavorful. Only tip for improvement would be to serve soup a little hotter. It was like warm by the time I was done, which didn't take long because it was super tasty stuff!

In the restaurant, there were two other tables occupied with 2 ppl each. My server came over to take my order, however I needed a little time since this was my first visit. During this time, 1 of the 2 tables emptied and I'm still waiting to place my order. I ordered hot tea and grilled chicken with rice noodles. I waited, and waited, and waited. Almost drank the whole pot of tea. Finally went to the counter and told them I wanted my order to go. I glanced back in the kitchen and there were two people (1 older female and male) besides my waiter. The lady who seemed to be doing most of the cooking was not wearing gloves and she plated someones food with her bare hands and then wiped her hands on her clothes. No one in the kitchen wore and apron, nor did I see hand or paper towels.  So that's another I will check off my list. My chicken wasn't half bad. Would just prefer more sanitary conditions.

The food is okay,its not the best food but it will do,I do really wish the place would follow their hours of operation,seems they open whenever they decide too get of bed as I have been there multiple times after they were suppose too be open,only too find the doors locked so I guess they are so rich they open whenever. the place is also rather dirty,I mean really dirty air vents,sticky tables and menus.Suggest too anyone just go some place else where you can actually eat instead of finding the doors locked all the time.

Well Shucks.  I wanted to like the local Chinese joint, but I was underwhelmed two times.  I had the basil chicken.  It just didn't taste very good - I really can't explain it.  The fried rice was real dark with nothing in it.    I can't remember what I got the second time I went... I did see crickets crawling around the floor both times I was there.  This is basically your typical local Chinese restaurant.  It is probably okay if you just want to stop by and get a quick cheap lunch.

So my gf family has been coming here for a few months now. & ive companied them a few times, this place is trash! I'm sorry, normally I wouldn't say that.. I feel bad because the cooks in the back are busting their butts trying to make of for the shitty service you get from the guy that is on his high horse every single time you go in there! Has an attitude, looks like he's always irritated with customers, & yells at his staff. Which makes me as a guest want to leave immediately, I can honestly say I left a $1.00 tip for that man... but asked for the girl in the back that was cooking and gave her $20. Its sad that the food is good, but hard for me to come here because of the guy you have to deal with to get the food! Smh

This place is aweful. The chicken in the fried rice was dried out, like they left it out all day long and the rice was drenched in soy sauce. The Egg Rolls, there was no need for the fish sauce because they already  Reeked of them before I even open the sauce. And it tasted like day old fish. The BBQ Pork Buns were the only thing decent, but the filling was more than half pork fat. Their management did nothing about the complaint except offer a Bobba Tea on my next visit. I'm not going back and I would suggest you don't either. Super disappointed!
This is probably my favorite Asian restaurant in North Las Vegas. I don't want to drive to Chinatown just to eat.
Great food ! Great service !!  Highly recommended ! A must try. Convenient clean and friendly atmosphere

I get Jasmine Express at least twice a month and it is always my splurge I love vermicelli noodles and their noodle dishes just so delicious and I love that I don't have to go all the way to Chinatown to get such delicious spring rolls they're normally priced but I do spend quite a bit of money they're ordering spring rolls crab rangoons and their vermicelli noodles

Where do I start... Coming into this establishment on a Sunday afternoon, they didn't have any customers seated just a bunch of other customers waiting for their boba order. I was starving and the employee seemed like he had a lot of his plate so I sat myself since I was dinning it. I was craving for a big piping hot bowl of pho. This was the only place open that was close to home. My usual pho place closes on Sunday... I tried this place a few years back.. so decided to try it again.   I ordered the combination pho, while my bf ordered the potstickers & Hong Kong crispy noodles w/ beef. We were both starving so I didn't have a chance to take a picture  of our food. The herbs that come w/ my Pho looked very old.... the Thai basil leaves were dark and the bean sprouts was brown. My Pho lacked flavor and tasted very watery. This is coming from an opinion of someone who eats Pho from various restaurants. It had a very very very faint taste of beef. I didn't finish my Pho. My boyfriend really enjoyed the potstickers though and it's sauce that came with. Although, the noodles was drenched in gravy so it was very very salty.    Customer service wasn't too great either. I asked for the BLUE Hawaiian sun iced tea in their fridge and the employee kept bringing me the wrong drink. He hardly checked up on us to see if we were ok and we had to seat ourselves. Keep in mind, it was a very slow day and we were the only customers seated.  The inside of the restaurant seemed filthy. There was food particles all over the floor, the tables were sticky, the condiment bottles had sauce all over them. Some tables still had dirty dishes.  Won't be returning...
Fist time back in a longggg time! Ordered the pho. Must say it has improved big time! Is it new ownership?? I dunno but I like it and I'll be back!

I've been to this place a couple times now and it's always great! They have very friendly service and great food! I've had the seafood pho both times and the aroma & flavor if the broth is the best I've had!

Jasmine Express is a solid go to choice to satisfy the need for good Thai on the tastebuds. The menu is s mix of different Asian dishes, mainly Chinese and Thai. The wide variety of drinks are a nice draw, including milk teas and Boba.   I order Thai dishes here, mainly Pad Thai and Panang Curry. They offer full portions at a reasonable price. While I prefer spicier dishes, their medium I would consider mild, the flavor is still full and very satisfying.  I would recommend trying one of the lunch specials before ordering the full entrees to make sure the flavor profile is to your liking.

Walking in randomly I saw they had boba milk...it was an experience...it didn't taste right and to top it off the boba was still hard in the middle and it was full of ice...not worth the $4.05 if you ask me...could get one for a better price and with a better taste down the street..will not be going back..

A year ago this place was GREAT. Now its a shithole with terrible customer service.  They upcharge once you arrive to pick up your food even though the online receipt includes the items.  The first time we figured it was a mistake, the second time in a row was unacceptable. We will never order food here again.

Let me start by saying that I have no idea why this place has so many negative reviews. So, if you're considering going here, but hesitant because of the reviews, I challenge you to try it. You won't regret it.   With that being said, as I pulled up to Jasmine Express, I was a little worried because of the cigar store next door. When I tried Viet Bistro at Tenaya and Lake Mead, it was disgusting because of the cigar smell. But anyways, as I walked in, I was greeted immediately. I ordered a milk tea boba and redeemed my free eggrolls coupon for my Yelp check-in to start. Very prompt service. My boyfriend and I both ordered Pho, as he was not feeling well. I got the rare steak pho. It was absolutely amazing. The flavor was incredible.   I have ZERO complaints about this place. I will definitely be back, sooner rather than later. So glad I finally found a place I can get pho that's not all the way in China town.
Food was really good, large portions. Would have liked to see more veggies- bok choy, etc

This place has good cheap food.  No complaints...the service was a LITTLE slow considering there we're a ton of people in there, but they did go BUY jallapeno's when I asked for more which was WAY above and beyond. We got the veggie spring rolls, thia tea and pho...it was all really good.  I got a yep appetizer for free and a buy 2 get one free thia tea, which was exciting!  Bottom Line: This is definitely a good Vietnamese place...I'll be going again.
